cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: There was a torrential downpour today where the rain reached a maximum intensity of 16.6mm per hour (ranked 2nd in our records).  The storm lasted 3.2 hours and 5.69mm of precipitation fell during that time.  On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

storm.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.
A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: A significant rainy period is on-going and is ranked 4th for length since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 10 consecutive days beginning 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (189°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 64.56 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.4°C) and outside temperature (down 2.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.9 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar), rainfall (up 0.9 mm), and light levels (up 4562 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 8074 lux), cloud levels (up 1492 m), and rainfall (down 0.4 mm) when compared to today.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and near calm conditions. Rain showers likely, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and periods of sunshine are expected. Weather could become unsettled.
